title: Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details
description:
Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details 20020212a.
Mnemonics.
No validation on the type field. The existence of the type is not too expensive (done in the type wizard for the super class), so it could be done. At least isValidTypeName.
Label could say 'Select destination type:'.

<Bug Behavior>
1. Browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes).
2. Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
3. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
4. Destination type can be source type: Refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.

<Expected Behavior>
1. I would use the title for 'Move static field(s)' and use the description for 'x fields from xx'.
2. Selection dialog should be initialized with the type currently entered.
OB:
The browse button in the dialog is too small.
The title is used for long text and should not display 'Type not found' when going to the next page.
Types from other projects are shown in the dialog instead of showing only types from the source folders of the own project.
The refactoring warns that moving the destination type to the source type will result in errors, but this is not true and it makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
EB:
The title should be used for 'Move static field(s)' instead of 'Dialog details'.
The description should be used for 'x fields from xx' instead of being left empty.
The selection dialog should be initialized with the type currently entered.
SR:
1. Increase the size of the browse button in the dialog.
2. Modify the title to not display 'Type not found' when going to the next page.
3. Show only types from the source folders of the own project in the dialog.
4. Remove the erroneous warning about errors when moving the destination type to the source type and the pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
5. Update the title to 'Move static field(s)' instead of 'Dialog details'.
6. Use the description to specify the number of fields to be moved from which class.
7. Initialize the selection dialog with the type currently entered.
